image.altText: Penny Wong at a press conference standing in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Australia's foreign minister says international recognition for Palestine could help "build momentum towards a two-state solution" with Israel.

title.children: Wong says peace for Israel will only come with Palestinian statehood

image.altText: A woman wearing a black cap and a khaki vest smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The IDF is still trying to explain exactly how aid workers, including Australian Zomi Frankcom, were fatally bombed by its forces in Gaza. But we could be about to find out whether Israel's military has learnt anything from its "grave mistake".

title.children: Why we're about to find out if the IDF learnt anything from its 'grave mistake'

image.altText: A three-panel split image showing a smiling young blonde woman, harsh bushland, and a smiling middle-aged blonde woman.

props.synopsis: About 16 per cent of all women allegedly killed by men in Australia this year have died in the Ballarat region. It may sound like an absurd figure, but data shows the rate of family violence in the Victorian town is higher than state and national averages.

title.children: What the hell is going on in Ballarat? With three women dead in two tragic months, it's a question worth asking

image.altText: A man wearing a baseball cap gives his dog a treat. They are pictured in a park.

props.synopsis: At Victoria Police, Peter Romanis says he can see the impact of compassion fatigue all around him. And it's led him on a search for answers.

title.children: Why spotting early signs of 'compassion fatigue' can help protect your long-term health

image.altText: A black and white image of a snow-capped street in a village with 1940s style cars parked outside cabins.

props.synopsis: A $6 million renovation of a neglected workers' village in the Victorian Alps will provide much-needed housing for mountain-based staff during this year's ski season.

title.children: Could this rundown alpine village built in the 1940s solve a tourism housing crisis?

image.altText: A woman rest her head on a pillow, she looks to the side, with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: People with chronic pain are suffering infections, shocks and even more pain from a device advertised as safe and effective. There are now calls for them to be recalled following a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: 'I'm so sorry': Teresa had a minor procedure to treat her chronic pain. The surgeon struck her spinal cord

image.altText: Signage on a store window reading "OPTUS YES"

props.synopsis: Protections introduced in the wake of the 2022 Optus data breach block more than 300,000 fraudulent attempts to use Australians' stolen data.

title.children: Australian register of stolen data blocks more than 300,000 attempts of identity fraud

image.altText: A woman with a green shirt and glasses looks through a rack of clothing in a consignment store.

props.synopsis: The rate of retail businesses entering insolvency more than doubles in two years as consumers battle a higher cost of living. The sector's lobby group is urging the federal government to provide retailers with support when it hands down its budget next month.

title.children: With the cost of living keeping customers away, more retailers are considering shutting up shop for good

image.altText: Sam Mostyn smiles while standing in a courtyard

props.synopsis: The history of our federation is groaningly replete with viceregal drama. What is rare, however, is for the announcement of a new governor-general designate to generate vicious denunciations on day one.

title.children: The vicious outrage levelled at Sam Mostyn quickly failed the pub test

image.altText: Two aerial photos of apartment buildings, one with greenery and the other with destroyed buildings and rubble

props.synopsis: Entire cities are transformed in the months since the October 7 Hamas attack and Israel's ensuing bombardment of the Gaza Strip. Drone footage shows the full extent of the damage.

title.children: 'There are no words to describe the pain': Drone footage reveals the extent of destruction in Gaza

image.altText: Matildas players congratulate Hayley Raso after a goal in a friendly against Mexico.

props.synopsis: Goals to Matildas veterans Hayley Raso and Caitlin Foord help the team overcome their injury crisis and notch a 2-0 win over Mexico.

title.children: Pair of long-range strikes give injury-hit Matildas 2-0 win over Mexico in Texas

image.altText: A man in a pink shirt with a laptop looking unimpressed

props.synopsis: Andrew Ryder's rainy-day bank account was drained in just one day. It happened via phone porting and SIM-swap fraud, but the veteran has no idea how scammers had his data in the first place.

title.children: Man's digital identity trashed and bank account drained after fraudsters steal phone number

image.altText: Neethu sits on a chair with her husband behind her, his hands on her shoulders.

props.synopsis: When Neethu Thomas attended hospital with a small amount of bleeding and cramps in her 38th week of pregnancy, she didn't expect to almost die. Questions are now being asked about her treatment.

title.children: Mother left in coma, uterus removed after traumatic birth at WA maternity hospital

image.altText: Toyota Hilux

props.synopsis: Angry car owners will take on two of Australia's car giants in the High Court today, seeking compensation for faulty vehicles made by Toyota and Ford that could run into billions of dollars.

title.children: Class actions against Toyota and Ford to be heard in High Court today

image.altText: A film still of Gillian Armstrong in close-up. She's in a newsroom and looking into the camera with a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Starring Gillian Anderson, Rufus Sewell and Billie Piper, Scoop is a glimpse at the story behind Newsnight's infamous interview with Prince Andrew about Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Scoop, about Prince Andrew's BBC interview, will make you feel a delightful sense of schadenfreude

image.altText: A large outside view of a compound

props.synopsis: Refugee advocates are concerned the men are being denied access to human rights websites, have been stripped of the ability to use messaging apps to contact loved ones, and are experiencing high levels of distress and anxiety.

title.children: First details emerge of rapidly filling Nauru detention centre following four boat arrivals in six months

image.altText: A blue building facade with a sign that reads "Pet Stock, where pets are family".

props.synopsis: Australia's competition watchdog, the ACCC, will be given far stronger powers to prevent companies making repeated under-the-radar acquisitions that could harm competition and consumers. The changes are the biggest reforms to merger settings in almost 50 years.

title.children: A pet care company achieved market dominance without the ACCC even realising, new laws aim to stop that happening

image.altText: a composite image of one man, a woman and another man

props.synopsis: With the Alice Springs curfew extended for a further six days, organisations and local advocates say it will do little to address the underlying issues driving youth crime in the Red Centre.

title.children: 'Absolutely working' or a 'bandaid solution': Alice Springs reacts to curfew extension

image.altText: A graphic of a large black-and-white steam ferry with a bridge in the background.

props.synopsis: The SS South Steyne, NSW's only heritage-listed vessel, sailed its maiden voyage on Sydney Harbour 86 years ago. But the prized ferry has been without a home on the harbour going on eight years as waterfront property takes precedence.

title.children: Former royal yacht of Queen Elizabeth left in 'limbo' after being moved from Darling Harbour

image.altText: A man wearing a navy suit grasps a blue booklet in two hands, in front of two microphones. The book is titled Budget Paper No. 1

props.synopsis: I'll still report on the budget's winners and losers next month, but I'll also aim to go deeper — to report on what's winning as well as who.

title.children: How about we try — just try — to report on budgets and tax differently?

image.altText: An idyllic view of blue water and a beach with green trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Ancient pottery fragments have been discovered on a Great Barrier Reef island that could change our understanding of Aboriginal history.

title.children: How a piece of pottery found on a beach stroll led to a discovery that could make us rethink First Nations history

image.altText: MONA Ladie's Lounge and Kirsha Kaechele and supporters.

props.synopsis: MONA refusing to allow a man to enter its Ladies Lounge was discriminatory, a tribunal has found. The tribunal's deputy president has also called out the behaviour of a group of women for their "performance art" during the hearing in March.

title.children: Tasmania's MONA gallery ordered to permit men inside 'women-only' lounge

image.altText: Sun setting through a line of transmission towers

props.synopsis: In what it says is the biggest poll of Australians' attitudes towards the renewable energy transition, the CSIRO finds almost half of those surveyed feel the shift should be moderately paced, and most are unwilling to accept higher bills to pay for it.

title.children: CSIRO survey finds most Australians want moderately paced energy transition

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has published final submissions made by Brittany Higgins in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Brittany Higgins gave 'unwavering' account of alleged rape throughout defamation trial: lawyer

image.altText: Man feeding baby a bottle

props.synopsis: Red Cross Lifeblood has had to bring in breastmilk from interstate to supply Queensland hospitals where it is needed for premature babies and those born with a low weight.

title.children: Queensland babies relying on interstate breastmilk donations as local supply falls

image.altText: An older man with a scruffy, grey beard wearing a blue jumper stands on a beach.

props.synopsis: People have been giving fisherman Craig Garland lots of advice as he prepares to become a member of the Tasmanian parliament. Among the wisdom is: "Don't wear a suit, don't dress up … you're not one of them".

title.children: A fisherman nicknamed Garbo is now an MP, and all it cost was a $3,000 campaign

image.altText: A picture of Jamie Dimon sitting in front of the JPMorgan Chase logo. He has white hair and black eyes. Wears a suit.

props.synopsis: The boss of JPMorgan Chase, one of the world's biggest banks, says interest rates in the US could reach 8 per cent as a range of "persistent inflationary pressures" weigh on the economy. Meanwhile the ASX opens half a per cent higher. Follow live.

title.children: US bank boss warns interest rates could reach 8pc as 'persistent inflationary pressures' remain, ASX opens higher

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX holds onto to early gains

image.altText: two little boys looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Leo and Darcy live with a rare, life-long metabolic disorder and need to take a supplement that helps their quality of life. But that supplement has now been removed from the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme, prompting calls on the supplier and federal government.

title.children: Leo and Darcy live with a rare condition. Now, the supplement they need has been delisted by the PBS

image.altText: King Charles looks at a book with bank notes in it being held by a man with a woman standing in the background.

props.synopsis: The king is presented with four new bank notes, two of which feature his portrait.

title.children: King Charles comes face to face with new British pounds featuring his portrait

image.altText: A pink and green aurora stretches over the sky above a shed in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: The Sun is putting on a show for Earth, with the highest level of geomagnetic activity in six years. Mawson Station chef Justin Chambers photographed a recent aurora and explains what it's like to watch the spectacle from about as far south as you can go.

title.children: The Sun is entering its 'solar maximum'. For aurora hunters in Antarctica, there's nothing 'quite like it'

image.altText: Jason Day points while standing next to Tiger Woods on a golf course.

props.synopsis: When the Masters tees off on Thursday, Australian star Jason Day will be playing alongside 15-time major winner Tiger Woods, who is hoping to make another miraculous run at Augusta.

title.children: 'I ache every day': Tiger's painful admission ahead of Masters pairing with Aussie Jason Day

image.altText: The hands of a child drawing with coloured pencils

props.synopsis: The Queensland government is moving to strengthen oversight of homeschooling following the death of a child known to the protection system but parents say it is overreach.

title.children: Homeschool parents concerned by government response to child's death

image.altText: James and Jennifer Crumbley sit at a table in court wearing prison clothes, awaiting sentencing

props.synopsis: In a landmark ruling, James and Jennifer Crumbley are the first parents convicted over a US mass school shooting.

title.children: Parents of Michigan school shooter jailed for at least 10 years

image.altText: Three woman stand in army uniforms in front of a large and colourful aboriginal painting smiling for the camera

props.synopsis: Major General Susan Coyle, who currently heads the army's Forces Command, is just the third woman promoted to a three-star rank in the ADF.

title.children: Defence's new chief of joint capabilities hopes her appointment will inspire more women to join

image.altText: Pickett1

props.synopsis: The AFL stands firm on a one-game ban for Melbourne's Kysaiah Pickett for a high bump on Adelaide's Jake Soligo, after changing rules earlier in the season.

title.children: 'This isn't the first conversation we've had': Demons to keep working with Pickett on 'modified' approach after another AFL ban
